website_summaries.verdict: This reservoir has a top-opening slide lock, which makes it a breeze to fill and lets you manually dry out any trapped water at the end of your hike.
pros: Wide-mouth opening with slide lock closure is easy to refill and locks securely

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first use! Not recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this bladder but it ruptured before I even left the trailhead. It looked to be high quality but a side seam split open soaking the entire contents of my pack. I'd filled it only about 2/3rds, packed carefully and headed out... On removing my pack from the car I noticed the trunk mat was moist, swung my pack on and water gushed out of my pack drenching my backside and legs. The only positive is that it happened near town, not way up in the Austrian Alps! Note photos comparing the 2 fused edges, one side nice and wide, the other about 1/3 the width... poor, poor quality contol!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, (relatively) easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Holds a lot of water (way better form factor compared to a water bottle of equivalent volume) and most importantly, it feels secure and doesn’t leak at all. I like being able to disconnect the tubes for drying / cleaning and the mouth opens well for the same purpose. I only wish it opened slightly larger, but it’s still better than most others I’ve tried.
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: High quality and strong materials. Basically no taste.
customer_reviews.text: High quality and strong materials. Basically no taste, WAY less than Camelbak and other reservoirs I've used before. I like the new design of how to put water in the container compared to the traditional design. Mounts for inside a backpack are pretty exclusive to Platypus bags because of two hanger slots, but could still be used in a standard backpack for hydration packs. The hose is quick detachable which is nice for cleaning and the mouthpiece is nice quality. I bought the mouthpiece cover separate but it should really be sold with the reservoir. Overall great product. Actually returned it though to get the 3 liter and backpack all-in-one.
customer_reviews.author: Lovely Lady

customer_reviews.title: Fits Into Osprey DAYLITE® PLUS Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Great reservoir so far! I bought this for my wife for her Osprey DAYLITE® PLUS pack. It fits well and did not have any off-putting smells or tastes in the water combing out of it. It's easy to drink from or to pour in another bottle with the Fast Flow Valve. The seams were super thick and durable all around. I'll come to Platypus if I need another one!
customer_reviews.author: Chappy

customer_reviews.title: NO TASTE - NICE DESIGN - BITE VALVE FAILED
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this bladder, but then in 3 months the bite valve started leaking. I contacted customer support to ask if they'd replace it, and I got an automated reply that they would respond in 4 weeks. In the mean time I ordered a replacement bite valve for $5 + $12 for shipping. I haven't found a better bladder, but I was frustrated with the valve and poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda G.

customer_reviews.title: It's big!
customer_reviews.text: Got the 3L one, and it's big. Adds a considerable amount of weight to a backpack, but probably the lightest way to carry 3L of water. Detachable hose is nice feature. Mouth valve takes a little getting used to if you've previously used CamelBak. One word of warning - the metal ziplock thing causes some element of concern to TSA agents at security. They thought it was a gun barrel. Probably best to leave it out on top if it's party of carry on luggage!
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Good, tough water reservoir
customer_reviews.text: We loved this water bag. We carried these on a backpacking trip to the Arizona trail. Used external to the backpack, it held up perfectly. Tough outer layer wasn’t bothered at all by the rocks when we laid them down. I reall6 like the fact the interior has a silver ion impregnating the keeps it bacteria-free. Quick disconnect hose made filling up with gravity drain filter easier because we didn’t have to keep holding the hose out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: barry

customer_reviews.title: My new platypus leaks
customer_reviews.text: I really like the platypus but I have to keep in straight up or it leaks. I have emailed the company but have not heard back. My husband has the exact same one that he bought at REI and he has no problems with it. I wish I figured this out sooner so I could have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Nat

customer_reviews.title: THE best
customer_reviews.text: This was my best purchase of the decade. Everything about it is perfect: easy to fill, easy to empty and clean, perfect amount for my 57-yr-old 5'4" body to use on 11 mile hikes in Desolation Wilderness, fits great in the AONIJIE Marathon Hydration Vest, sturdy, and replacement parts are easily available. Tried using it with a standard backpack on a long hike, it worked ok, but definitely needs something to hold it up to the top of the backpack (I used a carabiner hooked to an outer top handle). I really like that it's easy to fill from a commercial bottle-filler you find in many public places. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: MA Saylor

customer_reviews.title: great hydration bladder
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this hydration bladder for over a year now and must say i am so happy with it. It is easy to fill, easy to clean, i have had absolutley no problems with it at all. I did get the protective cap for the bite valve...that is a definite add on since if you do not have it, everytime you take your backpack off it gets in the dirt or is in contact with everything around it. I am a Platypus fan from now on...bye bye C...k!!!
customer_reviews.author: Plantfreak

customer_reviews.title: I won't be using any other hydration bladder in the future
customer_reviews.text: This kept me hydrated on my hike to the bottom of the Grand Canyon in the middle of June. The best feature of this is the baffle in the middle of the bag. While it make it a pain to clean, it keeps the bladder from filling up like a balloon. This make it WAY more comfortable against your back. Additionally, it uses standard fittings, so you can add inline filters or refill it from another bladder in the event that you need to share water on a long, hot hike.
customer_reviews.author: CKirk

customer_reviews.title: love the platypus, bought a second for my husband
customer_reviews.text: In the past I've used a Camelbak bladder with the screw-on lid, but it leaks more often than it doesn't! Luckily I gave the Platypus a try when I needed to buy a 3L bladder for a big hiking trip. It works really well and doesn't leak. I love the zip-top closure. I ended up buying the Camelbak insulated hose to swap out with this hose so that the line wouldn't freeze in cold weather. The hoses were easy to swap out. When my husband and I were planning a trip to Kili, we ended up buying another 3L Platypus for him that's identical to mine.
customer_reviews.author: J.Love

customer_reviews.title: Good water bag.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I'm very pleased with this insert bag. The ziplock is very secure- haven't had a leak yet. The mouth piece has a twist lock to prevent accidental leakage, too, when not in active use, as well as a pretty solid bit piece. In fact, the mouth piece is almost a little too secure and it can be a pain trying to get suction sometimes. But that is my only complaint; otherwise an excellent bag.
customer_reviews.author: bughillbilly

customer_reviews.title: Great Choice
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement for fluid pack that came with a bag I purchased a couple years ago. This was a vast improvement over the silicon bladder! It is comparable to or even better than the bladder that came with a hiking backpack I purchased from REI. A baffle in the middle gives extra support the top is a ziplock kind of closure with a handle and attaches easily to the click in the hydration pack. Will definitely purchase this product again when I need another one!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: I hike a lot but never used the hydration bladders I've gotten because they tasted terrible, I didn't like the bite value and the tube was always cumbersome. I ordered this for my first big trip of the season and I literally love everything about it! Out of the box I tested before washing and it has no plastic taste. I love the bite valve, quick disconnect, the opening style, locking ability and the suze/weight. I have already and will continue to reccomend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Hooray, It does Not leaks!
customer_reviews.text: Great hydro bladder. Filled it to almost the top and turned it upside down, No leaks! Easy to fill up and lightweight. Not very easy to clean but I will figure it out. The last $12 hydro bag I purchased was a disaster and leaked everytime I went to tie my shoe. Water poured out on top of my head and back. Then the access water dripped out the bottomed of my backpack all down my back and butt. It kept me cool but not hydrated. This bag works perfectly, you definitely get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: I recommend
customer_reviews.text: This bag is sturdy, easy to clean, and carries well. The quick connect tube to the bag is great. I would like a longer tube. Putting this in a large pack requires pinning it at the top instead of having it sit in the pocket. The bite valve is not the easiest to use. It works, but you twist the valve to open it, then bite, then suck, but it doesn't always work so you do it again and again until you get some water.
customer_reviews.author: Les H

customer_reviews.title: Leaking in Two Places
customer_reviews.text: Been using for this a while, and the leaks are frustrating. First, it started leaking at the valve, and there is a near-constant drip there. Then, a drip at the grommet started, where the "slide" closure attaches to the bag. So, if the bag is laying flat, it is possible for water to leak out of the grommet area. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: M. J.

customer_reviews.title: Bad taste
customer_reviews.text: Wanted the largest water bladder I could find that would live in the back of a small rucksack. Give this a quick rinse then filled it up with some tap water. Went to take a drink and it had this horrible plastic taste. Washed it out but haven't used it since. Hoping the next time it won't have that terrible taste . The construction of it is fine but maybe it needs a few washings ?
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave home without it!
customer_reviews.text: This reservoir goes with me on ALL of my backpacking trips and on a lot of my day hikes too. It is so much better than the bottles I use to carry. It is so much easier to have a sip of water at your disposal anytime you want it, even with trekking poles in both hands, rather than having to stop and get out a bottle. I stay better hydrated with this and am happier on the trail. I've never had a problem with it leaking, and there is no aftertaste at all like I hear some reservoirs have. The Platypus is a piece of my essential equipment for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pulls lots of air bubbles with the liquid; takes effort to draw water.
customer_reviews.text: (-) When drinking a bunch of air comes through; you get a lot of air bubbles in your mouth. So it takes more effort to draw water. The mouthpiece might be missing an o-ring or some type of seal. (*) If you don't turn the mouthpiece to lock it, it will drip on you slowly. (-) It can be hassle to dry the inside of the pouch. (+) Great value and can fit into most packs. I use mine in REI's Flash 22 Pack.
customer_reviews.author: Annimal

customer_reviews.title: I Like it.
customer_reviews.text: I Like it... I used it for the dirty water, cut the tubing and connected my water filter to it and then placed the end spout section to the discharge of my filter. It really did well, hanging on a tree, using gravity to run my dirty water through the filter, into the storage water bottles. The end spout has a valve, so that you can turn it off when changing bottles and/or if you have some water left in the "Platypus". I'm glad that I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best brand I've tried so far for reservoirs.
customer_reviews.text: I have had around 10 reservoirs from the major brands and this is by far the best. I use them for hiking and trail running, and I usually buy the brand to match my pack. There is no chemical smell, no staining and no dripping. I bought a cap for this one and fits perfectly. It basically solves every problem I had on my other reservoirs. The 3 liter is a little tall for my Osprey Skimmer 30 but I just fold over the top.
customer_reviews.author: Mellow N.

customer_reviews.title: Failed on first critical backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: I liked the two chamber design saved space, but this bladder quickly sprung a leak at it's edge on my first critical use backpacking Utah's 100 mile Uintah Highline trail. The first 20 miles have no water access, and my gear was soaked. A tremendous additional stress for entire trip. To recommend this could seriously endanger another person's life, and I just can't. Wide mouth made for easy filling, and I did like the two chamber design so its not one big bulge, but leak made it useless when I was counting on it.
customer_reviews.author: Drumdogma

customer_reviews.title: The taste is wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: When my family first started backpacking, I was shocked at how DISGUSTING the water tasted from our water bladders. Plastic! YUCK! After suffering with that for several years, I decided to go on the hunt for a better bladder. THIS ONE IS IT!! There is a slight plastic taste at first, but after the water flowed through the hose a few times it was pristine and delicious. We just got back from a 3-day wilderness trip in NWPA and everyone wanted the water from my bladder. ;) Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Mohnkern FamilyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Stays slim while full
customer_reviews.text: The draw from the tube is a little harder than I’d like but I think it works inversely so that it’s less likely to leak. Otherwise, I like the divider that keeps the bag from turning into a ball full of water. It makes it easier to slide back into the pack while full. So far I’m very pleased with how well it works. It could be a little lighter but for the added weight from the divider and the quality of construction I think it’s well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Totally Disappointing - Potentially Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Used this reservoir 3 times. Twice on generally easy day hikes. The third time I used it was on a back country 2 day hike in the Utah desert. 5 miles in to a 2 day hike the bag split open at the hose origin site and I lost half my water in a matter of seconds. The UTAH BACKCOUNTRY IN THE SUMMER is not where you want this to happen. I had to flip the bag over to save what I had left and spent the rest of the hike stressing about conserving water, unable to drink while walking. I will never buy another Platypus product.
customer_reviews.author: running toad

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best, with honors, sir!
customer_reviews.text: Of all the bladders, and I own several, this is the best one because (1) it does not leak at all, sealing with ease, (2) it is easier to handle since the tube has a clip to keep it out of the way or from dangling loosely as you try to work with the bladder, and (3) it is an easy fill and easy dry bladder, open top, that's it; no hole in the side with oblique angles for filling and trying to dry. I use the insulation sleeve from one of the bladders to hold this platypus bladder to keep the sun off of it. Avoid those side-fill bladders; too difficult to empty and dry out.
customer_reviews.author: GLW

customer_reviews.title: I didn't realize hydration could be this good
customer_reviews.text: Adding this to my backpack changed the game for how I rate Hydration packs. High water flow, easy to fill, no spill, and can hold a massive amount of water while staying relatively flat. I use this at festivals and it holds more then enough water to keep me going for an entire night. It's easy enough to clean that I can put electrolytes in it, and it's so far had no issues even though I am fairly brutal to it.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Thacher

customer_reviews.title: BEST water bladder on the market.
customer_reviews.text: PLATYPUS IS THE BEST WATER BLADDER AVAILABLE. I have backpacked over 2,500 miles and am a previous Appalachian Trail Thru-Hiker. Platypus bladders last for forever, can take a beating, are reliable and have never once leaked on me. The customer service of this brand (& warranty) is also unbeatable. 10/10 I wont buy another water bladder brand ever. Also compatable with a saywer water filter.
customer_reviews.author: Nico Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Great but very big.  Maybe too wide for smaller packs.
customer_reviews.text: Almost too wide for my Gregory pack. Everything about this bag is excellent, but make sure it'll fit your pack first. UPDATE: After two months of regular use, I really recommend this dromedary bag. No plastic taste. Great features. Worth every penny. Wish it was slightly narrower, but really not a problem for my pack. Win.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I really like this bladder except for the fact that you cannot pack much gear around it without having it leak. Any slight pressure applied by packed gear near where the hose connects into the bladder, will release a slight amount of water into the pack. I tried placing this Bladder in the pack different ways, packing the gear around it differently and laying the bladder on the top of the pack under the Lid. None of it helped.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Riney

customer_reviews.title: Backcountry Best
customer_reviews.text: Took this feller on a week long backcountry hike and hunt in Colorado, Sept. '19. It's AWESOME. I upgraded from the 1-liter version and am soooooooooooooooooo glad I did. It does add water weight to your pack, but, allows for less filter times at the creek. The quick connect and wide mouth make this thing an absolute YES in my pack next time I'm in the mountains. Get it. I promise you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney Yurksaitis

customer_reviews.title: Nathan Bladder is better
customer_reviews.text: This works, it does the job. I got it because it was in stock when my usual choice was out. I thought it would be the same since they both have the bag-likd mouths but it can't be turned inside out and takes absolutely forever to dry. I will say that it comes with a plastic spine that helps to keep it proped open when drying, it's useful! Not as useful as being able to flip it inside out.
customer_reviews.author: Lauraly

customer_reviews.title: Great flow - Nice clip, well worth the difference in price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sooooooo done buying the cheap ones - thats what they are. They leak and make you suck too hard (like I don't suck enough). These have a larger tube diameter and therefore more flow. There's also a handy retainer I attached to my station, that keeps it handy. Note: You need to line up the valve stem with flow mark on the junction.
customer_reviews.author: Mark D. Thornton

customer_reviews.title: great all around resevoir
customer_reviews.text: Works exceptionally well. I have used it in the Osprey day pack pouch and put it in the large front pocket of my larger business/hiking backpack and the tube is still long enough to reach my mouth. Quality seems very good and the tube quick release works very well. There is a seam down the middle of the reservoir that helps stabilize the bag. Perfect size. Depending on the temperature and/or the length /difficulty of hike will determine how much water I take.
customer_reviews.author: onemichael

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product, But Miss Easy Visual Of Water Level
customer_reviews.text: This is my first hydration pack with tube, and the product has worked well for me. It "hangs" on a small hook inside my pack. It is well made, sturdy, has no odor, and the bite/suck end delivers good water flow. All that said, I remain uncomfortable not being able to easily see how much water I have left (a knock on the concept, not the product). The only time I have ever run out of water on a hike was using this.
customer_reviews.author: GKC

customer_reviews.title: Great bladder
customer_reviews.text: I love how the zipper and clip are designed, it makes filling the bladder really easy and it is very secure to prevent leaks in the pack. The hose connection and hose itself are very robust and durable. I like the LP design, it sits flatter in the pack than regular bladders and makes it easier to fit my other items around it when packing.
customer_reviews.author: jared arand

customer_reviews.title: love that they can be filled without taking tubing out ...
customer_reviews.text: The design of these bladders are basically fail-proof. Other bladders with screw-lids can be tough to get off or leak. I've not had a problem with these, love that they can be filled without taking tubing out from your pack, and basically can store an extra one and pop it into the tubing.
customer_reviews.author: pinkabu

customer_reviews.title: Will not disappoint
customer_reviews.text: I am training for a 1/2 marathon and needed a new water reserve for my Camelbak mule. I purchased the platypus big zip because of the reviews I read, the great reputation platypus has and because it would be easier to dry out and prevent mold from forming. It has lived up to all my expectations, and has become a trusted companion on those long miles!
customer_reviews.author: Speedynana

customer_reviews.title: Excellent water reservoir, definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.text: The Big Zip reservoir works great. It holds a lot of water, and it's easy to fill thanks to the zipper on top. The hose works great -- I appreciate that the mouthpiece and hose can both be easily detached. Seems very durable so far -- no problems with leakage anywhere. I cut the hose and attached a Sawyer Mini water filter inline with it, with the help of some hose clamps; this works great both for filtering as you drink, and for filtering lots of water with gravity (thanks to the removable mouthpiece). The two of these, plus some other water container, have basically become the entirety of my water filtration system.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Beaty

customer_reviews.title: The quick disconnect hose and large mouth made this perfect for my water collection and purification system on the ...
customer_reviews.text: The quick disconnect hose and large mouth made this perfect for my water collection and purification system on the Appalachian Trail. I used the Steripen to purify my water. This requires collecting water in a one liter, wide-mouth container, then stirring the pen for 90-seconds to zap all of the bad stuff. Since I wanted to use the bladder, the large zip opening made it easy to pour a liter at a time into the bladder. There are a couple of drawbacks to using a bladder in general, but they have more to do with the function of a bladder and nothing to do with this actual product.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Garner

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is amazing. Tough, east to open and fill and close without even removing the bag if you want, or by unclipping the hose. Won't leak, and made of strong material. The mouthpiece is easy to use, precise, and has high flow levels, the valve is brilliant. The No need to spend any more money on a bag.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ormandy

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough to survive this clumsy, fat guy!
customer_reviews.text: I put this bladder in my Osprey Talon 22. It fit perfectly and has been completely leakproof. On a hike in Bryce National Canyon I took a spill and landed squarely on my back and to my amazement, the bladder didn’t burst! I’m a little over 200 pounds and I landed on stone - I was really impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Stwalley

customer_reviews.title: No Leaks But Hard To Drink
customer_reviews.text: The main reason I got this bladder was due to frustration with other bladders that constantly leaked (that means you Camelbak) if you didn't screw on the cap just so. Bladder does NOT leak - it's foolproof to seal it up so there are no leaks. However when you drink from it the bite valve lets a very small trickle of water through. You have to have the valve rotated just so in your mouth or you get nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Kenmed

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Well designed, well made, and does not impart a taste to the water. I replaced the little alligator clip (that clips the drinking end of the hose to a strap on the front of your pack) with a magnetic clip from another manufacturer. Hiking perfection.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Totally love it!!
customer_reviews.text: After having a bladder hose mishap with my orginal BCG bag I was hoping for something that would work with the same bag. Not only does this huge 3l fit it works better than my orginal and better than my wife's camelbak. We can even squeeze the mouth piece by hand and refill our son's little thermos. No plastic taste and no leaking even when I forgot to shut the valve!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Thronesbery

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing-
customer_reviews.text: While this seems to be plenty tough, the ziplock is difficult to actually zip. There is a plastic thing that seems like it is supposed to force a zip, it doesn’t. I have had this thing leak out and get all the stuff in my pack wet. I pretty much have to fill it, leave it on the counter for a while and see if there’s a puddle before I land it into my pack. Either that, or make sure the pack is never lying down so that the opening is always up. Disappointing. Other than that, it’s great. But wet stuff sucks.
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: 1 month in and mold
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed. I’ve had this for a month now and it has mold in it already. I live in oh so dry CO and it’s had nothing but water and been allowed to fully dry between all uses. I love my soft bottles from Platypus and I’ve had them for years with no mold so this is a huge disappointment
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Nice bladder
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because this thing doesn't give a cap and it's actually pretty expensive for just the bladder itself. Other than that I use it about 3-4 times a week when I go on my hikes and it supplies me with enough water for my 3-6 milers, fits perfectly in my Rush 72, and most of all doesn't leak
customer_reviews.author: Pixel Guy

customer_reviews.title: It does NOT leak!
customer_reviews.text: Bladder that is leakproof. It is three-liter. Get the 3-liter model. You can always fill it with one or two liters if you need only one or two liters. If you need three, it is better to have the three liter than not to have it available. It is easy to fill. It is leak-proof.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Nakamura

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best.
customer_reviews.text: The very best most amazing and feature-rich hydration bladder out there. I'll never use another kind. As other reviewers have stated, there are several genius features here: Easy disconnect hose that you can detach while full and during filling. (so much easier than trying to manage a squirrelly hose in the sink) Low profile due to the baffling in the center that makes it much less 'bulgy'. Easy to close (and open) with a great handled, tethered closure. Super wide mouth for ease of filling. Non-drippy bite valve still has lots of flow. Easy to lock, as well.
customer_reviews.author: R. Masterson

customer_reviews.title: didn't fit pack due to wider top
customer_reviews.text: Not a review on use since it wouldn't fit my pack. The top of the reservoir is wider than the bottom and didn't fit right. It also seems much larger than the same size Hyrdapak, which fits perfect. I like the idea of tube connection near the top, not sure how helpful it would actually be.
customer_reviews.author: echoman

customer_reviews.title: No Leaks
customer_reviews.text: The slide top takes a little getting used to. Honestly prefer the closure on my Nathan bag. On the plus side, it doesn't leak, like my Nathan, The quick disconnects work well and make cleaning a snap. Speaking of Nathan, this doesn't fit so well in their products. I have two Nathan vests and I bought this as a replacement for my (leaky) Nathan bag, It fits, but it's a tight squeeze and unfortunately decided against using this on an ultra as I didn't want to spend the extra time trying to get it in my vest. Overall good quality and I see it lasting a long time.
customer_reviews.author: DocM

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY - Design flaw! Ripped after first use.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this bladder. It ripped after just ONE trail run. As you can see from the photo, the bladder is stitched together, creating a flat plastic layer that holds the seal together. The problem with this design is that all it takes is one little nick or crease to that hard outer plastic, and inevitably, with a little time (or just one - 20 mile trail run) that stress will begin to tear. The result will be a tear into the bladder which is probably why several reviews here have complained of water leaks and failures. These bladders are too expensive for this kind of unreliability. Spend your hard earned money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: LoKeyGuy

customer_reviews.title: This does not leak. I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Ditch your stupid Camelbak reservoir that leaks all over. Seriously. I was so frustrated with my Camelbak and this is the number one rated pack reservoir for a reason. I hike all over the Western and Pacific States. I know what I like and I like this. Period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Large Water Baldder!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as an addition to my high-country hunting, scouting, and trekking pack. I was split between this bladder and the one offered by CamelBak, but decided to go with the Platypus after reading and watching a few reviews. I am very happy with this product as it is very durable, reliable, and easy to use. The zip-lock and slide feature for closure is a game changer for me and is the reason I rated this product with 5 stars. If you are looking for a large water bladder that is durable and features an expert closure system you have found it!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Great bladder!
customer_reviews.text: Great bladder, love the baffle and the big opening. The shutoff is nice too. The only reason for a 4 vs 5 star rating is because I had to open (cut a bigger slit) up the opening to get better flow.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Been using this for years and it's just as good as the day I got it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this bag for several years now and it is just as good as the day I got it! I'd highly recommend the 1.5L for anyone needing a smaller reservoir for things like day hikes or trail running.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: ... product after doing a lot of research and I'm glad that I did as I was pretty close to ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product after doing a lot of research and I'm glad that I did as I was pretty close to getting the camelbak. I appreciate this product even more as I tried to fill up the bf's camelbak and couldn't get it right and it spilled all over the kitchen counter. With the camelbak I found out the hard way that you need to be very precise as to how far you should fill it; and the top that comes with it is not user friendly. With the platypus it's like using a large Ziplock bag and it's easy to clean and dry out.
customer_reviews.author: Regina S.

customer_reviews.title: Very strong plastic chemical taste.
customer_reviews.text: Although it claims to have a “clean taste guarantee” water drawn from the 2L hydration bladder I received had a very strong chemical (plasticizer?) taste that persisted through several fills and never went away. I returned the product for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: pjsinwyo

customer_reviews.title: Horrible plastic taste
customer_reviews.text: Great product, but it had a heavy, persistent plastic taste, which was a deal breaker for me. No matter how many time I cleaned it out, it wouldn't go away. I tried to contact the manufacturer via their website, but I never heard back from them. Given their "clean taste guarantee" and strong track record prior, I did not want to disparage their product here without giving them an opportunity to address it. I was even thinking that maybe I was shipped a "knock off", and maybe this one isn't the real thing. Since they never responded to me, I am now forced to write this 1 star review.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Absolute life saver and wonderful investment. I work outdoors & keep this hooked ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolute life saver and wonderful investment. I work outdoors & keep this hooked up in my backpack all day long. It also helps measure how much water I take in a day, which is usually the whole pouch, plus some spare bottles I keep in my bag. The mouth piece is comfortable & the whole thing is easy to clean/rinse, though I only keep water in there. On hot days, I can freeze water in the pouch, so it can melt during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorsy

customer_reviews.title: worthless piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: The first time it was used it leaked all over my back pack so had no water to finish the hike.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect
customer_reviews.text: Functionally perfect. The two liter size is great, especially for long hot all day trail hiking. Four stars for two things that probably aren't fixable with this design. The first mouthful of water is warm because it gets heated sitting in the plastic tube exposed to the sun. The bladder is difficult to purge of water for storage. I ended up wadding a paper towel and pushing it up into the container to soak up the remaining moisture after it is emptied. I'm assuming a moist environment is a breeding ground for mold or bacteria, so what take a chance on putting it away wet? Otherwise very happy with the construction and the function.
customer_reviews.author: bkrisinger

customer_reviews.title: Nice design with one exception
customer_reviews.text: Nice design with one exception. Easy to fill and clean, detachable hose is a real advantage. However the bite valve is a poor design. After one ride replaced it with a Camelbak bite valve. The Camelbak valve flows better and seals more reliably.
customer_reviews.author: Jobs Gates

customer_reviews.title: Never Let Me Down
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a 300 mile backpacking trip. This thing was outstanding. No leaks. The material is robust enough to pull out and fill, lay on rocks or sticks or dirt. This bladder took a good beating and never let me down. No weird tastes. Happy to buy the 3L, as sometimes distance between water sources was a little long. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bree Saxe

customer_reviews.title: Should have bought this a long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: It works very well as the 2 liter does. Skip the 2 liters and just buy this. It fits most packs. The only hassle is the bite valve comes off easily when going through brush. Get a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Solovino

customer_reviews.title: Hydration
customer_reviews.text: We have now ordered a platypus for each member of our family to use while hiking and have found it easier to use than all of the other hydration packs before it. We can easily add ice, seal it properly and it is ready to use for any outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice hydration reservoir
customer_reviews.text: I've had many hydration reservoirs over the years and this is the best so far. The average rating on the "Easy to clean" category is simply because there is a web in the middle of the envelope. This is a good thing! It just makes it a little more difficult to clean. I just can't stick my hand through the wide opening and wipe it down. I use a wooden ruler with a cloth wrapped around the end, then shove it in each of the two compartments (cells?) to wipe and dry. It works.
customer_reviews.author: 127PX

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for long summer runs
customer_reviews.text: I've run with this hydration bladder in a hydration pack for over 150 miles and it's held up perfectly with no issues. The blue text has faded slightly in spots but there are no concerns about the integrity of the bladder itself. The tube attaches very tightly and the top zip function has worked 100%. The bite valve isn't my favorite style but it's a small personal preference nitpick about an otherwise great bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Alex O

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I find this reservoir difficult to fill. It is awkward to try to keep a grip on it while holding the mouth of the bladder open to fill. I got this to replace an old Camelbak reservoir based on great reviews. I prefer the Camelbak style and will probably be purchasing another
customer_reviews.author: Jennie-Laura

customer_reviews.title: ... Platypus brand for several years and have never been disappointed. Also
customer_reviews.text: I have bought Platypus brand for several years and have never been disappointed. Also, I would recommend the open slide top instead of the side screw cap because it is less annoying if you are putting in ice and easier to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Used this on a backpacking trip this weekend and I love the twist lock mouthpiece
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my old Platypus for about 25 years now and thought it may be time for an upgrade. Used this on a backpacking trip this weekend and I love the twist lock mouthpiece. The flatter profile fits my Osprey Volt 75L pack perfectly and it's easy to fill. I need to pick up a mouthpiece cover though. Tired of wiping off dirt. Hope this one lasts as long as the last one!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Knock off
customer_reviews.text: I was sent an unbranded POS in platypus packaging. Wrong color, 1 liter smaller than the packaging says, doesn’t have the chest clip or the straw doodad that makes the flow faster. I have had a bunch of platypus products in the past, and they have all been awesome. Not sure who is responsible for this fraud, but I’m confident it is not platypus.
customer_reviews.author: B-Man

customer_reviews.title: Best product
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Bought for hiking, and used for 5 day trek in Patagonia (Chile). Easy to refill, and zip closure ensures no leakage, which was a concern with the twist tops of other brands. Easy to clean. We didn’t notice a strong smell/taste upon initial use.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Wiley

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Boys took on trek to Philmont Scout Ranch. Bladder ruptured first day.
customer_reviews.author: jesseed

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like Plastic
customer_reviews.text: If you like to throw money away and give it to these people. Then buy this garbage. It tastes like plastic and no matter how many times you wash it. It tastes like balloon material. Better off just using stainless containers....
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: Nice, durable bladder for a reasonable price. Hiked up Mount Saint Helens with two of these in my pack, no issues. Use them on every hike now! I love that they fill from the top. I’ve never gotten the hang of filling the other kind without spilling everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: It keeps me moist and I love it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fantastic bladder. I’ve run about 100 miles with it and I love it. The baffle that keeps it from being floppy is extra special.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Rueben

customer_reviews.title: Best bladder out there
customer_reviews.text: I own two of these now. I've ran the first one in my Eberlestock J34 "The One" pack for a bunch of years now. It works great and is durable. I've ordered this second one to go in my hiking day pack. As they say in the Army, "Drink watER!".
customer_reviews.author: Stone06

customer_reviews.title: Leaked on delivery
customer_reviews.text: Like a fool I did not test this before leaving for a trip, and it leaked terribly from multiple holes in the side on the seam.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: The best one on the market.
customer_reviews.text: The easiest bladder bag to use! We took these into the Grand Canyon. Worked perfect in our hiking backpacks. The simplicity and durability is so worth the money. Save yourself the headache and just buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Q.

customer_reviews.title: Love 3 liter capacity
customer_reviews.text: Having 3 liter capacity is a game changer. This will get me through a full day of mountain hiking. Two liters will not. No longer need to carry a filter on long day hikes The removable hose works great. Doesn't leak a drop. Top closure is also very secure. Only minor complaint: the mouthpiece valve is not as good as CamelBak. Not sure what is different, but it does not work as well.
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bladder with weird taste-clean first!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this bladder! Warning: it’s heavy if you fill it the whole way, but dang does it come in handy for summer hikes. Sucked this dry after a 11 miler in July, but it’s a great bladder and easy to clean. But, it took 3 cleans and uses to get rid of a plastic taste.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Reinert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent reservior. Been using it for two months now with no issues. The bite valve allows a good flow with not a drop of leakage. The bag is easy to fill and seals perfectly with the slide on ziplock style top. It's easy to dry. It's durable and well made. It has proven to be my favorite of all the hydrations systems I've used.
customer_reviews.author: uglytuna

customer_reviews.title: No leaks, lots of water.
customer_reviews.text: This 3L version fit perfectly into the Osprey Daypack Plus. It didn't leak when I tested it. The bit valve works awesome. Overall I love it. No more running out of water or carrying multiple water bottles for me!
customer_reviews.author: Robert A Moreno II

customer_reviews.title: Won’t work in my backpack
customer_reviews.text: This will only allow water to flow for drinking if I hook it above me. Then I get good tasting water. However if I put it in my small hydration Sierra backpack there is apparently not enough gravity for it to flow to the bite valve. Useless for the purpose of biking and hiking for which I bought it! :( At least I can use it when I’m camping and can hang it in a tree.
customer_reviews.author: A. Shiley

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these for a 10-day hiking trip at Philmont Scout Ranch - one for me and one for my son. They fit perfectly into our Ospray backpacks and the large opening allowed for easy filling. The tube detached easily and never leaked. I would highly recommend also buying the Platypus Bite Valve Cover to keep the bite valve clean.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slow water flow and air bubbles
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. The water flow is so restricted, you have to have major sucking power to get the water out. Also when I'm trying to drink from it, it's making a bunch of air bubbles at the mouth piece end. I've had positive experiences with this brand before but this product was a let down.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Works well and fits nicely in my Kelly Redwing 50 daypack
customer_reviews.text: Works well and fits nicely in my Kelly Redwing 50 daypack. The bite valve is hard to use. I have to bite hard for very little water. Will replace it with a Camelback valve.
customer_reviews.author: JimLinda

customer_reviews.title: Nice Water Reservoir
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for an older 3 liter reservoir which finally, after many years, sprang a leak. The wide mouth is easy to fill and it fits into the reservoir bag in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: anonymity lover

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean and dry, no weird smells, all the pieces parts work great. So much better than my old thread top camel back bladder - love the slide-closure style.
customer_reviews.author: JennyG

customer_reviews.title: Best Water Bag on the Market!
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints, other than I tore a small part of the mouth piece trying to get it off the first time to clean it - my bad, not Platypus'. I have two older Platypus' that are still great, but developed leaks. The quick disconnect on the hose it great! The ziplok mouth always seals. I love this bag!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for those who don't enjoy the "plastic taste"
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for those who don't enjoy the "plastic taste". I hate plastics and have almost totally eradicated them from my home. I drink from mainly glass and metal containers, so I find the plastic taste very strong when I do have to drink from a plastic container. When I was planning a week long hike, I had to break down and take a plastic water bag due to obvious weight issues with carrying metal water bottles. My sister recommended the Platypus and I was actually quite happy with it. It served it's purpose well, held up during the trip and I did not taste the plastic when drinking.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on a 12 day back country hike
customer_reviews.text: I used this water bladder on an 82 mile (12 day) back country hike on Phimont Ranch in New Mexico. It worked flawlessfl. I was really happy with the performance. It took me some time to figure out how to dry out the bladder properly and get all the condensation out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome. Absolutely no taste which was a big seller for me because my camelbak made me nauseous with the plastic smell. I got the 3L mainly for me and my dog. We'll drink the whole thing on a day hike. If he needs water I just open the top(which is very simple) and pour it into a dish. There is no leaking for the outlet and the zipped top is very secure. Like many people have said it's like an industrial ziploc bag. I would recommend buying the bite valve cover so you don't get dirt on it in case you have to put your pack down fast.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Osprey daylite
customer_reviews.text: Fits in my Osprey Daylite like a glove. I like how the tube can be closed off at the mouthpiece. The added strap holder is a nice touch, I attached it to the sternum strap.
customer_reviews.author: Honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME. EASY. WORKS.
customer_reviews.text: So easy. Works great. No leaks. No bad taste (although I did have it running through a Sawyer, then carbon filter (I'll update if it taste funny without). Anyways, this is the best thing ever. Also, if you want to dry it out, simply hang it with the opening at the bottom on the end of a broomstick and wait a day or two. I'm using this for a "dirty water bag" (from streams) because it is so easy to fill.
customer_reviews.author: this_guy

customer_reviews.title: Mehhh
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes but like so many others this was a miss. Plastic clip broke after about a month and the leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Platypus Big Zip Water Reservoir for Hydration Backpacks, 3-Liter, LP with Standard Valve
product_meta.description: Size:3-Liter| Style:Lp With Standard ValveThe Platypus Big Zip Water Reservoir for Hydration Backpacks offers an evolution in hands-free, taste-free hydration. Available in two styles: The EVO with Fast Flow Valve and the Standard Valve. The Fast Flow Valve delivers an extremely high flow rate (50% more than the Standard Valve), self-sealing HyFLO bite valve, large 5/16-inch drink tube, simple one-handed filling, easy cleaning, fast drying, quick access drink tube disconnect, and leak-proof shutoff valve, while the Standard Valve features a 1/4-inch drink tube, easy cleaning, and a low profile design. The Big Zip is a top pick for hikers, backpackers, travelers and mountain bikers for their hydration backpacks. This hydration reservoir features embedded silver-ion to protect clean water from mold and bacteria. All materials are certified food-grade, BPA-, BPS-, phthalate-free and taste-free for a clean taste. The Platypus Big Zip+ is available in 3 sizes: the 1.5-Liter measures 8.5 x 13 inches and weighs 5.6 ounces; the 2.0-Liter measures 8.7 x 15 inches and weighs 6 ounces, and the 3.0-Liter measures 9 x 17.2 inches and weighs 6.5 ounces. Manufacturer’s limited lifetime warranty. Made in the USA.
feature_bullets: Premium taste-free, leak-proof reservoir with low profile design offers hydration on the go for hikers, backpackers, travelers and mountain bikers
Secure SlideLock slides both ways to open reservoir easily and close it securely
Low-profile design with center baffle helps reservoir ride flat in a pack
Features Standard Valve with 1/4-inch drink tube
3.0-Liter measures 9 x 17.2 inches and weighs 6.5 ounces; manufacturer’s limited lifetime warranty; made in the USA
